column4: Hey, is there an android app that works with ubuntu that lets me use my phone like a remote control for hulu desktop and other media?
I'm looking for a simple arrow key thing, not a mouse controller.  I have one of those.
there is xbmc remote and vlc remote
does it work with any program in linux, as if it were a keyboard?
there is also transdroid which I can recommend heavily
tell me more plx
the xbmc remote acts like a DVD remote and has lots of great buttons, check it out
vlc remote lets you control volume, fullscreen and what is playing
but do i need xbmc for it to work?
for xbmc remote, yes
nvm the xbmc then, I don't use it.  Unless it's compatible with wii and hulu.  Then I'll change my mind XD
there is also this http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/01/remotedroid-lets-you-control-your-desktop-using-your-phone/
I have remotedroid, I was thinking something more like an actual remote, with arrow keys and volume.
and an ok button.
http://masl.cis.gvsu.edu/2011/05/20/demo-of-android-based-remote-control-app-for-hulu/
does hulu allow remote controlling by web ui etc?
hulu desktop allows remote controlling via an IR computer remote, a wiimote (if you have BT), etc.
there's also apps like playon.tv that broadcast hulu to the wii and roku via your PC, but all are windows/mac only.
there is unified remote in android store for very little cash which can talk to hulu
seems to be windows only
there's tons of windows apps.  all I want is a free remote app... that looks like a remote
the vlc one and xbmc is all I know dude
I'm resigned to play my computer to the tv.  I'll look into xbmc.  tyvm :)
